results.title: Singapore: the emporium
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Zain Hussain
results.brief_description: Singapore is one of the world’s natural junctions, as Stamford Raffles, its founder, perceived little more than a century ago when it was only a fishing village. To-day it is a major world trading centre and one of the greatest international ports. The enterprise skill and toil of men of many races and creeds raised from a swamp this great city where over a million people live and prosper.

results.title: Singapore: new Asia on stage (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: MM-Multimedia People, Singapore Tourism Board and National Arts Council
results.brief_description: System requirements: Pentium 166 CPU, Win95 0/S, 4xCD-ROM, 32 MB RAM, 16 bit sound card, 640x480 pixel resolution, 16 bit colour. Singapore is not only the cultural meeting point between the East and West, but also one of the most diverse and dynamic cities in the world. This CD Rom is an atmospheric, colourful, and informative guide to the role and works of various performing arts companies within Singapore. Explore a variety of artistic genres, including folk, classical, contemporary and avant garde in this compilation of stunning Singaporean talent.

results.title: Singapore: Crossroads of Asia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Travel to exotic Singapore, the ancient trading port poised on the tip of the Malay peninsula that has become a 21st century commercial centre. Stroll across the Padang to admire Parliament House and the Singapore Cricket Club, visit the temple of Heavenly Happiness, Sultan Mosque and Raffles Hotel, home of the Singapore Sling. Shop on Orchard Road, play on Sentosa Island and cap your visit with a tour of Singapore by trishaw.

results.title: Singapore: a study of a port
results.creator_credit: Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and Brian Salt
results.brief_description: Singapore is taken as an example of a city which exists by reason of its function as a port. Opening scenes introduce the harbour, Singapore River and statue of the founder, Sir Stamford Raffles. Maps illustrate Singapore’s position of shipping routes and explains the reasons which lead Raffles to establish a port there. The scope and nature of port activities are illustrated. Local industries and resources, nature of the hinterland, malaria control and climate are dealt with. By means of maps and actual scenes, the nature of the different quaters of the city is examined in detail.

results.brief_description: Big Bird and his friends invite you to have some silly fun with eleven of their favourite silly songs. Sing along with Ernie, Oscar the Grouch, Hoots the Owl and other Sesame Street favourites. Includes a song-lyric poster.

results.title: Sing Out for Wales
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, David E. Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Royal National Eisteddfod is an annual celebration of the Welsh language and culture, particularly as expressed in mass choirs and poetry. The miserable weather conditions of this particular Eisteddfod do little to dampen the enthusiasm of the participants as they gather to elect the prize-winning bard of the year.

results.title: Sing of the border
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and Tony Thompson
results.brief_description: The songs of the Scottish border country are more than just folk songs. They are the history of a people. Families fought for power along the border, and the ballads have preserved their names and deeds. Although battles have passed, the country and the pattern of life remain much the same today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and Tony Thompson

results.title: Sing and be happy with Jane Pickens
results.brief_description: A musical sing-along with Jane Pickens (with audience participation and bouncing ball). Songs include: ‘I’ll be walking with my honey’, ‘I never knew’, and ‘I’ll see you in my dreams’.

results.title: Sing a little
results.brief_description: Illustrates a Canadian Broadcasting Company radio session of which Allan Mills is compere. Three songs are presented: “The Farmer’s cursed wife” whom even the devil wouldn’t keep; “Barbara Allen”; and “Jack the sailor” who was swallowed by a whale. Animated puppets enact the story told by each song.

results.title: Sine Curve
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Donald Batchelor
results.brief_description: Discusses the sine funtion. Illustrates familiar periodic motions and uses models to analyse the nature of a wave motion and to show how a sine curve can be drawn. From the series “Visions in mathematics”.
